0.Cons: cutting of hours on a regular basis

1.Pros: Most of the employees are customer focused and team work is encouraged. Work life balance is good and the company is very supportive of family commitments.
1.Cons: Very political environment. If an employee is not aligned with the "right" manager/team it is very difficult to get noticed. Many employees stay in positions for too long making change and innovation very difficult.

2.Summary: "Would definitely recommend for high school students."
2.Pros: As a high school student myself, it's great to have such a lenient schedule so that I can have time for school and for myself.
2.Cons: For the amount of work you put it, you start to realize you should be getting payed more.

3.Cons: Lots of working hours, minimum wage, no benefits

4.Cons: Turn over rate ridiculous. Bad senior management

5.Pros: Everyone is very helpful and also works together
5.Cons: Their are no cons its absolutely fine .

6.Summary: "Anton wanting to be apart of the great mcdonalds team!"
6.Pros: a good working environment to be around, with nice people that I would want to be apart of and I like mcdonalds
6.Cons: some customers can be mean and rude but as an employee you have to keep your cool to make the business look professional

8.Pros: Working as a team they are like family. Everyday is different , fast pace and challenges each day . They have a awesome training program which continues through your career
8.Cons: Staffing. Very long hours. Bonus program does not exist. No salary increase since new owners

9.Pros: Flexible schedule, advancement opportunities great training, free food, and free drinks,
9.Cons: working weekends is a must, customer can complain about anything that you do and you will get in trouble no matter what, high turnover.
